Enter the name of a non-existent java class in a Java attribute row on the 
extensions page.

Click on the 'class' link.  The java attribute wizard comes up.

Click Finish to generate the class.  You will get the following stack:

Hrm.  I'm wondering if this is a JDT problem somehow since it was just running 
a createType from the NewTypeWizardPage.  Let me look into it.

Good news is that current code from head (from pde, pde.build, pde.core, pde.ui,
ui.forms) works on the M8 build.   

Thus, ignore my JDT comment since it looks like a dup of bug 57675/50631.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 50631 ***

Looking at Bug 57675, John raised an issue that should have been seen here. 
Creating the class was creating an unnecessary lock on the part of PDE.  Thus,
not running the class creation in a workspace runnable solves all problems.

I am reopening this bug because it requires a change in PDE's implementation.

Please see Bug 57675 and Bug 50631 for references on why this bug occurred.
